text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that any goods to Northern Ireland from third countries (such as China or the US) must meet all EU product safety standards. The response addresses this under the section 'For goods from third countries (your China example)': 'Coming directly to NI from China \u2192 presumed at risk \u2192 Red Lane \u2192 full EU customs procedures apply'. Furthermore, the section 'The \"Two Markets\" Reality' states: 'NI must follow EU rules on goods standards (Annex 2 of the Protocol - SPS measures, product standards, VAT on goods, etc.)'. This confirms that goods entering NI, regardless of origin, are subject to EU product standards if they are deemed 'at risk' or if they are subject to Annex 2 rules, which is the general rule for goods in NI under the Protocol/Framework.", "criterion_id": "e4a1ae1b-a58e-4d31-bec4-4cf261c4a1c4"}
